metadata.feature_description: Main analytics dashboard showing overall community metrics including user engagement, content creation, and activity trends

steps.expected: User should be logged in successfully
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Click on Dashboard icon and hover to reveal submenu
steps.expected: Dashboard submenu should appear with Site Analytics and Community Analytics options
steps.actual: Dashboard submenu appeared showing Site Analytics and Community Analytics options

steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load with Answers tab selected by default
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded successfully with Answers tab active, showing Community Health metrics, Engagement charts, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content sections

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View dashboard with different time periods (Day)

steps.action: Click on the date range picker
steps.expected: Time period dropdown should appear with Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom options
steps.actual: Time period dropdown appeared with all expected options

steps.expected: Dashboard should update to show daily data with hourly intervals on charts
steps.actual: Dashboard updated to show single day (27 Feb 2026) with hourly intervals (00:00, 03:00, 06:00, etc.) on engagement charts. Comparative Term changed to 1d. Some metrics show N/A for 24-hour metrics which is appropriate for single day view.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View dashboard with different time periods (Month)

steps.action: Select Month from the time period dropdown
steps.expected: Dashboard should update to show monthly data with daily intervals on charts
steps.actual: Dashboard updated to show date range 28 Jan 2026 - 27 Feb 2026 with daily intervals on charts. Comparative Term shows 1m.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View dashboard with different time periods (Year)

steps.action: Select Year from the time period dropdown
steps.expected: Dashboard should update to show yearly data with monthly intervals on charts
steps.actual: Dashboard updated to show date range 28 Feb 2025 - 27 Feb 2026 with monthly intervals (MAR, APR, MAY, JUN, JUL, AUG, SEP, OCT, NOV, DEC, JAN, FEB) on charts. Comparative Term dropdown is hidden for yearly view.

steps.action: Select Custom from the time period dropdown
steps.expected: Custom date picker should appear with From and To date calendars
steps.actual: Custom date picker appeared with two calendar controls - From date (2025-02-28) and To date (2026-02-27) with month/year dropdowns, navigation buttons, and Apply button

steps.expected: Dashboard should switch to show Blogs-specific metrics
steps.actual: Dashboard successfully switched to Blogs view showing Blogs-specific Community Health metrics: 'Blogs older than 6 hours with no Views', 'Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments', 'Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Dashboard data display with actual content

steps.action: View Wiki section which has actual data
steps.expected: Wiki metrics should display with real data values
steps.actual: Wiki section displays actual data: Community Health shows 'Articles older than 24 hours with no Views: 100%', Engagement: 100% with Formed Relationship: 9, Creates: 7, Views: 1. Trending Tags show: test (12), social (4), group-wiki (4), metadata (2), programming (2), bookmark (2). Popular Content lists 5 wiki articles.

steps.action: Observe Comparative Term values displayed alongside current metrics
steps.expected: Each metric should show both current value and comparative term value
steps.actual: All Community Health metrics display both current percentage and Comparative Term percentage side by side. The Comparative Term dropdown allows selection of 1w, 1m, or 1y for comparison.

steps.action: Click Export button for Answers section
steps.expected: Analytics data should be exported as a file
steps.actual: Export triggered successfully and downloaded file 'Answers.xlsx' containing analytics data

steps.expected: Dashboard should adapt layout for tablet viewing
steps.actual: Dashboard adapted to tablet width: PersonaBar narrowed, metrics cards rearranged to fit, charts scaled appropriately, all content remains accessible

steps.expected: Dashboard should adapt layout for mobile viewing
steps.actual: Dashboard adapted to mobile width: PersonaBar collapsed to icons only, metrics cards stacked, charts narrowed but still functional, engagement metrics visible at bottom. Layout is functional though some elements are partially visible.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: All content type sections load correctly

steps.action: Verify all 6 content types display properly (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)
steps.expected: Each content type should have its own section with relevant Community Health metrics, Engagement charts, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content
steps.actual: All 6 content types are present and display correctly: Answers (Questions metrics), Blogs (Blog-specific metrics), Discussions (Topics metrics), Events/Social Events (Events metrics), Ideas (Ideas metrics), Wiki (Articles metrics). Each has appropriate contextual health indicators.

observations: The Community Analytics dashboard is a comprehensive multi-section dashboard that displays analytics for 6 content types: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, and Wiki

Each content type section includes: Community Health metrics (contextual to the content type), Engagement charts with weekly/monthly/yearly data, Creates & Views metrics, Trending Tags, and Popular Content
The dashboard supports time period filtering: Day (hourly), Week (daily), Month (daily), Year (monthly), and Custom date ranges
Comparative Term feature allows comparing current metrics against previous 1 week, 1 month, or 1 year periods
Export functionality generates Excel (.xlsx) files with analytics data
The dashboard is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes, though the mobile experience could be optimized further
The Wiki section had actual data demonstrating the dashboard displays real metrics correctly
Code repository was empty - testing was conducted purely through UI exploration
Some pointer interception issues were encountered when switching tabs, but functionality was confirmed working through alternative interaction methods
